thread.title: Dead body found in closet at the Magic Castle in Hollywood
thread.title_full: Dead body found in closet at the Magic Castle in Hollywood

author: CHRIS SOMMERFELDT
title: Dead body found in closet at the Magic Castle in Hollywood

organizations.name: magic castle los angeles police department

text:
Dead body reportedly found inside closet at renowned Magic Castle in Hollywood Dead body found inside closet at Hollywood's Magic Castle Los Angeles Police Department officers guarded the entrance at the Magic Castle magicians' club on Friday night. (CHRIS HELGREN/REUTERS) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated:  12 AM 
A man was mysteriously found dead at the iconic Magic Castle in Los Angeles on Friday night, and authorities suspect they could be dealing with a suicide. 
Cops responded to the exclusive Hollywood magician's club and fine dining restaurant after receiving a report of a dead body around 7:30 p.m. local time, police said. 
The victim's identity was not immediately disclosed. A Hollywood police spokesman told the Daily News that foul play couldn't immediately be ruled out, although investigators suspect that the death was self-inflicted. 
Responding paramedics supposedly discovered a man, only wearing his underwear, dead inside a closet, according to TMZ . The man had a bag over his head and appeared to have hung himself, according to the gossip site. 
A police spokesman told The News that the TMZ report was "on point," but declined to officially corroborate the ghastly details. The Hollywood landmark opened up its doors in 1963. (Mario Anzuoni/Reuters) 
A front desk clerk at the Magic Castle hung up the phone when reached by a News reporter early Saturday. 
The Hollywood landmark opened up its doors in 1963 and caters specifically to magicians and illusionists, brandishing itself "the most extraordinary private club in the world." The club offers fine dining and magic shows. It also touts a "Clubhouse," which is only accessible to professional magicians and their guests. 
"A typical evening — if there even is such a thing here — features magic shows that range from miracles right under your nose to full stage illusions that stun an entire room," reads an entry on the Castle's website .
